title: Breakfast Isn't the Most Important Meal
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Breakfast Isn't the Most Important Meal.

hook.text: 'Breakfast is the most important meal of the day' was coined in 1944 â€” by a cereal company ad campaign.

buildup.text: General Foods (makers of Grape-Nuts) hired a marketing agency to boost cereal sales. The slogan worked perfectly.

discovery.text: Studies showing breakfast eaters are healthier suffer from a flaw â€” healthy people tend to eat breakfast anyway.

twist.text: Randomized trials show skipping breakfast has no negative effect on metabolism or weight for most adults.

climax.text: Intermittent fasting research suggests skipping meals can have metabolic benefits for some people.

punchline.text: Breakfast is great if you're hungry. Not because a cereal ad said so.

quiz.question: Who coined the phrase 'breakfast is the most important meal of the day'?
